meanings.definition: To cover or shield with a visor.
meanings.sent1: She was vizoring her eyes from the bright sun.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys vizoring his face during outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The cat was vizoring its face with a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The knight vizored his helmet before heading into battle.
meanings.sent5: Vizoring her face made her feel protected and cool.

meanings.sent1: He was vizoring the visor to shield his eyes from the sun.
meanings.sent2: She likes vizoring a visor when playing tennis.
meanings.sent3: The dog was vizoring a visor while chasing the ball.
meanings.sent4: The hiker vizored the visor to see the trail clearly.
meanings.sent5: Vizoring a visor helped him see without squinting.

meanings.sent1: They were vizoring the helmet with a protective visor.
meanings.sent2: The workers were vizoring the safety gear for the construction site.
meanings.sent3: The robot was vizoring its head with a shiny visor.
meanings.sent4: The soldier vizored the helmet for added protection.
meanings.sent5: Vizoring the helmet with a visor made it safer for use.
